Description: Postcard; printed paper; collage of colour photographs showing the Great Pyramid and Sphinx at Giza, an Egyptian dancer posing with a tambourine and four Arabs praying next to their hobbled camels.
Curator's comments: Used. Message dated 25th September but the year is not given and is indistinct on the postmark; the stamp has been already soaked off. The message is from Mary and reads: "Arrived here today. Expect to go to the Pyramids on Tues[day]. Enjoying the trip very much - had my pictures taken on a camel and then rode on an elephant up a steep road to a palace for 20 min[utes]. The weather has been very hot and humid". The pictures on the face capture the marketing of Egypt as a place of Pharaonic monuments and Orientalist romabnce to a Western tourist audience.
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Pyramid of Khufu
Acquisition notes: Purchased from Terry, Antiques Garage, New York, 27th April 2013.
